2. Capture organic traffic through SEO-optimized bike pages and news.


3. Enable peer-to-peer used bike selling.


4. Monetize through seller subscriptions, featured listings, and dealer badges.

Build strong resale marketplace liquidity.

Establish verified dealers.

Create a loyal rider community.

6.2 Contextual Emotional Recommendation Engine (Bike Page Level)

Recommendations are generated dynamically on every bike detail page.

Two sections appear:


---

A. Similar Bikes (3â€“4 bikes)

Purpose: Help users compare competitive alternatives in the same category.

Logic inputs:

Category (sport / naked / commuter / cruiser)

Price range (Â±10â€“15%)

CC range

Bangladesh popularity

Resale value

Brand demand


Rules:

Same category only

Never show the same model

Prefer bikes with higher resale and demand


Example:

User views CFMoto 300SR

Similar bikes may include:

Yamaha R15 V4

KTM RC 200

Suzuki Gixxer SF

TVS Apache RR310


These reflect emotional alternatives, not just spec matches.


---

B. Used Bikes Near Budget (3â€“4 bikes)

Purpose: Trigger value-based emotional buying.

Logic inputs:

Current bike price

User budget psychology

Market resale trends


Rules:

Price Â±10%

Prefer higher segment bikes

Prefer premium brands

Prioritize verified sellers


Example:

Viewing new CFMoto 300SR (~4.6 lac)

Used bikes may include:

Yamaha R15 V4 (used)

KTM Duke 200 (used)

Yamaha MT-15 (used)


User realizes they can upgrade brand or segment at same budget.

Initial implementation is rule-based.
Future versions may use machine learning.
